newsitem.title: USA: FX Energy pauses for Orneta 1 changes.
newsitem.headline: FX Energy pauses for Orneta 1 changes.

text.p: FX Energy Inc said work on the Orneta 1, the first oil and natural gas exploratory well drilled in Poland by a western company, has been halted to condition the well bore, run logs, set and cement casing, and drill out and replace the current mud system with a KCL polymer.
These steps, expected to be completed in 7 to 9 days, will allow us to drill into the Cambrian under the "cleanest" possible circumstances, the company said. It is drilling the well with RWE AG.

FX Energy said Mondaay the Orneta 1 well is now in the Ordovician at a true vertical depth of 2,379 meters (7,805 feet). This is an estimated 5 meters (16 feet) above the potential sandstone reservoir in the Cambrian.

After the efforts now underway, "we then plan to drill into the Cambrian horizon with a core barrel, cut two 9 meter cores and, if warranted, run a drill stem test through the cored interval. Thereafter as we drill through the potential reservoir we will take additional cores and drill stem tests as warranted.
The entire process of drilling through the potential reservoir, which will begin in 7 to 9 days, may take several weeks because of the extensive testing which may be conducted.
Orneta 1 drillsite supervision is provided by Parker Drilling Co. ((-- New York Newsdesk 212-859-1610.))
